Expectation1: Be considerate with shared spaces and boundaries
Situation1: My dog becomes vocal in the hallway when people pass near shared doors.
Situation2: Savings are set aside and friends are going this season.
Story: I’ve always tried to be a good neighbor, keeping the hallway tidy and making sure my dog, Rumi, doesn’t disturb anyone. But lately, he’s been barking more whenever someone passes our shared door, and Mrs. Patel from next door has started leaving notes about the noise. I feel guilty every time I see her, knowing I should do more to keep the peace. At the same time, my heart is pulled in another direction. I’ve been saving for years to go on Hajj, and this year, my friends are finally going. The money I’ve set aside is just enough, but I know the building is considering soundproofing the hallway, and they’re asking for contributions. If I help, my Hajj savings will take a hit. If I don’t, I risk being the inconsiderate neighbor. The pressure from both sides is suffocating—my faith calls me to fulfill a lifelong dream, but my conscience nags at me to be thoughtful of those living around me. I stand in the hallway, Rumi at my side, torn between two worlds, unsure which path to take.
